meanings.definition: In a way that can be distinguished or differentiated
meanings.sent1: She spoke discriminably, making sure each word was clear and separate.
meanings.sent2: The colors on the flag were discriminably different from each other.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to read the text discriminably, but they all mumbled together.
meanings.sent4: The music notes danced discriminably across the page, each one unique and clear.
meanings.sent5: The detective examined the footprints discriminably, looking for any distinguishing marks.

meanings.definition: Capable of being recognized or identified
meanings.sent1: The suspect left a discriminably unique fingerprint at the crime scene.
meanings.sent2: The logo was designed to be discriminably different from competitors.
meanings.sent3: The cat had a discriminably loud meow, surprising everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting was so neat and discriminably hers, it was easy to recognize.
meanings.sent5: The rare bird had a discriminably colorful plumage, standing out in the forest.
